definition: to draw (towards)/to be drawn to/to be sucked in
to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: Water is held so tenaciously that most plant root systems cannot absorb it.
sentences.chinese: 水被牢牢地吸住以至於不能被大多數植物根系吸收。

sentences.english: We can use a pooter to suck the smaller insects.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以用捕吸管來吸住微小的昆蟲。

sentences.english: She was drawing him in with those tears, that wobbling voice.
sentences.chinese: 她的淚水和瑟瑟的聲音吸住了他。

sentences.english: Coaster has a small magnet can attract the love spoon.
sentences.chinese: 杯墊有小吸鐵石可以吸住勺子。

sentences.english: I felt an instant magnetism when our eyes met.
sentences.chinese: 當我們見面時，我感覺被她磁性般地吸住。

sentences.english: When you drink, the ball is blocked by the gravity in the recess of the glass.
sentences.chinese: 當你飲用時，球會被凹陷的玻璃吸住，阻止其滾出。

sentences.english: She is a force of gravity in her long gray dress.
sentences.chinese: 灰色長裙下的她就像一股地心引力牢牢將他吸住。

definition: to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
to hook onto/to hitch onto/to catch onto
to jam/to choke/to clutch/also pr. [qia3 zhu4]
to adhere to a surface/to absorb/to draw in/(fig.) to attract/(chemistry) adsorption
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to be unable to move a single step
